item.title: "Skills" -JAVA-
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

One of three things is happening here:

  1. xpRate is being modified at run-time and when you’re performing the calculation, it isn’t 50.
  2. The code that checks the calculation and calls LevelUp isn’t being executed.
  3. You’re expecting the message to appear in the client but you’re printing to the console, which you’re not checking.

Read full topic

item.title: "Skills" -JAVA-
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

if(playerXP1 == 5000){ playerLevel1 = 10; Levelup(0); }

This is only checking to see if the int playerXP1 is equal to 5000, so unless xpRate is 50 then nothing will happen

item.title: "Skills" -JAVA-
item.dc:creator: @RSPS222 RSPS222
item.description:
@RSPS222 wrote:

Look at my code (not all of it):

   playerXP1 =	(int) Math.floor(xpRate*100);
        if(playerXP1 == 5000){
        	playerLevel1 = 10;
        	Levelup(0);
        }

I asked a question like yes or no and the the scanner checks if my answer is yes then
playerXP1 = (int) Math.floor(xpRate*100);
after that i added if(playerXP1 = 5000){
playerLevel1 = 10;
Levelup(0);

	public static void Levelup(int Skills){
		switch(Skills){
		case 0:
			System.out.println("Congratulations!, You promoted a level in health your level is: " +playerLevel1);
		
		}
	}

Why when i am answering yes its dosent display that Levelup message?
Thank you very much

Read full topic
